ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: About how often did you get together with friends or relatives, like going out together or visiting in each other's home?
Notes: 1=Every day; 2=Several days a week; 3=About once a week; 4=2 or 3 times a week; 5=About once a month; 6=5 to 10 months a year; 7=Less than 5 times a year; 8=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: About how often have you had friends over to your home? (Do not count relatives)
Notes: 1=Every day; 2=Several days a week; 3=About once a week; 4=2 or 3 times a week; 5=About once a month; 6=5 to 10 months a year; 7=Less than 5 times a year; 8=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: About how often have you visited with friends at their homes? (Do not count relatives)
Notes: 1=Every day; 2=Several days a week; 3=About once a week; 4=2 or 3 times a week; 5=About once a month; 6=5 to 10 months a year; 7=Less than 5 times a year; 8=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: About how often were you on the telephone, chatting online or skyping with close friends or relatives?
Notes: 1=Every day; 2=Several days a week; 3=About once a week; 4=2 or 3 times a week; 5=About once a month; 6=5 to 10 months a year; 7=Less than 5 times a year; 8=Prefer not to answer

ElementDescription: How often have you attended a religious service?
Notes: 1=Every day; 2=Several days a week; 3=About once a week; 4=2 or 3 times a week; 5=About once a month; 6=5 to 10 months a year; 7=Less than 5 times a year; 8=Prefer not to answer
